commits.subject: refactor!: remove /v3 module suffix for cleaner imports
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message:
refactor!: remove /v3 module suffix for cleaner imports

BREAKING CHANGE: Module path changed from github.com/felixgeelhaar/bolt/v3
to github.com/felixgeelhaar/bolt. All import paths must be updated.

- Replace github.com/felixgeelhaar/bolt/v3 with github.com/felixgeelhaar/bolt
  across all Go source files, go.mod files, and documentation
- Update version references from v3.0.0 to v1.2.1 in example/benchmark modules
- Run go mod tidy on all modules

commits.subject: fix: skip performance regression tests under -race detector
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message:
fix: skip performance regression tests under -race detector

The race detector adds ~20x overhead to timing measurements, making
latency thresholds meaningless. Skip performance regression tests
when -race is active; use benchmarks for accurate performance data.

commits.subject: fix: relax complex event latency threshold to 500ns
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message:
fix: relax complex event latency threshold to 500ns

The 350ns threshold was too tight and caused flaky failures under
system load variance. Typical runs complete in ~280ns, so 500ns
provides sufficient margin while still catching real regressions.

commits.subject: fix: skip intentional race test under -race detector
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message:
fix: skip intentional race test under -race detector

TestUnsafeBufferRaceDetection intentionally races on a shared
bytes.Buffer to demonstrate that races originate from unsafe writers,
not the logging library. Skip it when the race detector is active
to prevent false test failures.

commits.subject: chore: update nox baseline for new features
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message: chore: update nox baseline for new features

commits.subject: docs: update README with new features and remove incorrect v3 branding
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message:
docs: update README with new features and remove incorrect v3 branding

Document all 10 new features (Uint8/16/32, CallerSkip, Stringer, Ints/Strs,
IPAddr, Dict, MultiHandler, Hook/SampleHook, NewLevelWriter) with code
examples and performance data. Remove "Bolt v3" product branding per
project convention while keeping Go module import paths unchanged.

commits.subject: feat: add 10 new features for production parity with zerolog/zap
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message:
feat: add 10 new features for production parity with zerolog/zap

Add Uint8/Uint16/Uint32 field methods, CallerSkip for wrapper functions,
fmt.Stringer support, Ints/Strs array fields, zero-alloc IPAddr formatting,
Dict nested objects, MultiHandler fan-out, Hook/SampleHook event interception,
and NewLevelWriter io.Writer adapter. All new field methods maintain the
zero-allocation guarantee (0 allocs/op verified via benchmarks). Includes
comprehensive unit tests, race tests, performance regression tests, and
testable examples for all features.

commits.subject: fix: disable gosec G115 analyzer to work around upstream panic
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message:
fix: disable gosec G115 analyzer to work around upstream panic

The gosec v2.23.0 conversion_overflow analyzer (G115) panics on
constant expressions like `1024 * 1024` with error "1e+06 not an Int".
Disable until the upstream fix is released.

commits.subject: chore: update nox baseline for README AI-006 false positive
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message: chore: update nox baseline for README AI-006 false positive

commits.subject: feat: add slog.Handler, testable examples, and documentation improvements
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message:
feat: add slog.Handler, testable examples, and documentation improvements

- Implement slog.Handler adapter (slog.go) backed by Bolt's zero-allocation
  serialization, supporting WithAttrs, WithGroup, and level filtering
- Add comprehensive slog.Handler tests (slog_test.go) with race detection
- Add 13 testable examples (example_test.go) for pkg.go.dev rendering
- Migrate benchmarks from golang.org/x/exp/slog to stdlib log/slog
- Fix deploy-pages.yml Go version from 1.21 to 1.23
- Update CONTRIBUTING.md Go version from 1.19 to 1.23
- Add documentation links to release workflow and goreleaser config
- Update README with slog integration docs and handler comparison guide
- Migrate golangci-lint config to v2 format

commits.subject: chore: add nox security baseline for known false positives
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message:
chore: add nox security baseline for known false positives

Baseline 27 findings that are false positives or expected patterns:
- SEC-163: test UUIDs/trace IDs in bolt.go and test files
- IAC-314/315: contents/packages write permissions in release workflows
- IAC-306: OIDC token write for GitHub Pages deployment
- IAC-351: id-token permission misidentified as hardcoded secret
- SEC-161: awk format string and sed pattern in deploy/Makefile
- AI-006: logger output in README code example
- DATA-001: intentional security contact email in SECURITY.md
- IAC-013/157: felixgeelhaar/nox@v1 pending release tag
- IAC-308/310/018: intentional workflow_dispatch and continue-on-error

Also excludes findings.json from scans and version control.

commits.subject: fix: pin all GitHub Actions to commit SHAs for supply chain security
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message:
fix: pin all GitHub Actions to commit SHAs for supply chain security

Pin 13 actions across 7 workflows to immutable commit SHAs:
- actions/checkout@v4 (34e1148)
- actions/setup-go@v5 (40f1582)
- actions/cache@v4 (0057852)
- codecov/codecov-action@v5 (671740a)
- golangci/golangci-lint-action@v6 (55c2c14)
- actions/upload-artifact@v4 (ea165f8)
- github/codeql-action/upload-sarif@v3 (f5c2471)
- goreleaser/goreleaser-action@v6 (e435ccd)
- actions/configure-pages@v4 (1f0c5cd)
- actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3 (56afc60)
- actions/deploy-pages@v4 (d6db901)
- amannn/action-semantic-pull-request@v5 (e32d7e6)
- softprops/action-gh-release@v2 (a06a81a)

Resolves 39 high-severity IAC-013 findings from nox security scan.

commits.subject: chore: add nox security scanning, update CI toolchain, and fix version references
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message:
chore: add nox security scanning, update CI toolchain, and fix version references

- Add nox security scanning workflow with SARIF upload and badge
- Add weekly fuzz testing workflow targeting 5 fuzz functions
- Add dependabot for Go modules and GitHub Actions updates
- Update Go test matrix from 1.21/1.22/1.23 to 1.23/1.24
- Bump golangci-lint-action v4 to v6, codecov-action v4 to v5
- Replace deprecated benchcmp with benchstat for benchmark comparison
- Raise coverage threshold from 30% to 70%
- Fix README version references from v2.0.0 to v3
- Fix Go version badge from >=1.19 to >=1.23
- Add pkg.go.dev Go Reference badge
- Remove continue-on-error from gosec security job

commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message: chore: track relicta release state directory

commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message: chore: add github token config to relicta plugin

commits.subject: chore: add coverctl and relicta configuration
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message:
chore: add coverctl and relicta configuration

- coverctl: domain-based coverage policies (core: 30%, examples: 0%)
- relicta: conventional commit versioning with GitHub release plugin

commits.subject: fix: make module proxy warming step non-blocking
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message:
fix: make module proxy warming step non-blocking

The pkg.go.dev indexing may fail initially for new releases since
it takes time to index. Added continue-on-error: true and individual
error handling to prevent release workflow failures due to this
non-critical post-release step.

commits.subject: fix: resolve CI failures and security vulnerabilities
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message:
fix: resolve CI failures and security vulnerabilities

- Fix GoReleaser workflow by removing coverage.txt before release
- Remove deprecated Jaeger exporter from opentelemetry example (use OTLP)
- Update golang.org/x/net to v0.48.0 to fix CVE vulnerabilities
- Update grpc-interceptors dependencies

commits.subject: feat: add /v3 suffix to module path for Go semantic import versioning
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message:
feat: add /v3 suffix to module path for Go semantic import versioning

Updates the module path from github.com/felixgeelhaar/bolt to
github.com/felixgeelhaar/bolt/v3 to comply with Go's semantic import
versioning requirement for modules v2+.

Changes include:
- Update root go.mod module declaration
- Update all submodule go.mod require and replace directives
- Update all import statements in Go source files
- Update installation instructions and code examples in documentation
- Update badge URLs to use v3 path

This enables users to properly import the module using:
  go get github.com/felixgeelhaar/bolt/v3

Closes #5

commits.subject: docs: update README with separate benchmarks module instructions
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message:
docs: update README with separate benchmarks module instructions

Updated documentation to reflect benchmarks moved to separate module in v3.0.0. Clarified how to run comparison benchmarks and removed obsolete -tags=bench flag.

commits.subject: refactor: move benchmarks to separate module to remove zerolog/zap dependencies
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message:
refactor: move benchmarks to separate module to remove zerolog/zap dependencies

Created separate benchmarks module with its own go.mod to avoid forcing users to download zerolog and zap dependencies. Benchmark comparisons remain available in the benchmarks/ directory.

commits.subject: docs: update README with accurate v2.0.0 benchmarks and fix broken links
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message:
docs: update README with accurate v2.0.0 benchmarks and fix broken links

Updates:
- Version references: v1.2.2 → v2.0.0
- Performance badge: 70ns → 63ns (actual benchmark)
- Benchmark table: Updated with real v2.0.0 numbers
- Sample results: Corrected to actual test output
- Performance characteristics: Updated timings

Fixes:
- Removed broken documentation links (docs/ deleted)
- Updated to point to GitHub Pages for live benchmarks
- Fixed cloud platform integration links
- Updated framework integration references to examples/

Accuracy improvements:
- Simple log: 63ns/op (was 70ns)
- Float64: 62ns/op (was 66ns)
- New fields: 60ns/op (Int8/16/32)
- Console handler: 491ns with 10 allocs (was inaccurate)
- All numbers verified with go test -bench

commits.subject: fix: add +incompatible suffix to v2.0.0 in http-middleware example
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message: fix: add +incompatible suffix to v2.0.0 in http-middleware example

commits.subject: fix: skip performance regression tests in CI
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message:
fix: skip performance regression tests in CI

Performance regression tests use testing.Benchmark which can report
false positive allocations in CI environments due to GC behavior.
These tests are now skipped in short mode to prevent flaky test failures.

For accurate performance validation, use: go test -bench=. -benchmem

Changes:
- performance_test.go: Add testing.Short() check to skip in CI
- .github/workflows/ci.yml: Add -short flag to count=5 test run

commits.subject: fix: resolve CI test failures and example build issues
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message:
fix: resolve CI test failures and example build issues

- Fix flaky concurrent handler test by using ThreadSafeBuffer
- Move ThreadSafeBuffer to shared test_helpers.go
- Add go.mod files to examples (rest-api, batch-processor)
- Update grpc-service go.mod with proper dependencies
- Fix unused variable in grpc-service example
- Use replace directive to reference local bolt v2.0.0

Changes:
- test_helpers.go: Shared ThreadSafeBuffer for concurrent tests
- handler_edge_test.go: Use ThreadSafeBuffer for concurrent access test
- race_test.go: Remove duplicate ThreadSafeBuffer, keep Reset method
- examples/*/go.mod: Add module files with replace directives

commits.subject: feat: v2.0.0 - Go best practices & repository cleanup
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message:
feat: v2.0.0 - Go best practices & repository cleanup

BREAKING CHANGES:
- Removed enterprise infrastructure directories
- Simplified repository to focus on core library
- Removed migration tools and documentation

Code Quality:
- Reduced complexity (55→15, 17→5)
- Fixed staticcheck violations
- Go Report Card: A+ rating

Module Best Practices:
- Cleaned unused dependencies
- Modernized golangci-lint config
- Upgraded staticcheck to latest

Repository Cleanup:
- Removed 63 files (9,013 lines)
- Consolidated documentation
- Fixed flaky concurrent test

Performance Maintained:
- 62.96ns/op, 0 B/op, 0 allocs/op
- 85% test coverage
- All tests passing

commits.subject: docs: reorganize documentation following GitHub best practices
commits.author: Felix Geelhaar
commits.raw_message:
docs: reorganize documentation following GitHub best practices

Organizational Changes:
- Moved detailed docs to docs/ folder: DEVELOPMENT.md, ENTERPRISE.md, PERFORMANCE.md, TROUBLESHOOTING.md
- Kept GitHub-recognized files in root: README.md, SECURITY.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, CONTRIBUTING.md, CLAUDE.md
- Added comprehensive docs/README.md with navigation and links
- Updated main README.md with clear documentation section

Benefits:
- Cleaner root directory
- Better documentation discoverability
- Follows GitHub community standards
- Maintains automated GitHub features for community files

commits.raw_message:
chore: improve .gitignore for test directories and temp files
